Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2009 10:42AM patou wrote: Hello Jancie, I have the same thing than you (tendon sticking out in the underarm) and I did not do much, don't even have a horse!  My surgeon told me to massage the underarm and push in the tendon very gently.  She said something like it was due to a vein thrombosis or some other technical thing I did not understand.  I will ask again how this happened but it is not anything I did.. just a side effect from the surgery/healing process. I am going to see a physical therapist that will help me with some movements and gentle exercises to get back my full arm function limited by that tight tendon.  By the way, I had a lumpectomy (twice last was 10 days ago) and 4 nodes removed (1 month ago).
Posts.Title: "Lumpy" SNB Incision Site Kleenex Springtime
